examples.sentence: The wacky professor wore mismatched socks to teach quantum physics.
TikTok's wacky challenges always go viral in 24 hours.
Elon Musk's wacky ideas often become billion-dollar businesses.
The baby happily squished the Play-Doh into colorful wads.
She absentmindedly rolled her gum into a wad during the meeting.
The old fisherman pulled out a wad of banknotes from his boots.
My grandma always keeps a wad of yarn in her knitting basket.
The dentist put a wad of cotton in my cheek after extraction.
Ancient armor often used cloth wads as padding.
He earned a wad of cash by livestreaming durian eating.
The influencer received a wad of fan letters after the viral video.
Angry fans wadded up the concert tickets and threw them away.
She waded the love letter into a ball before bursting into tears.
The tailor waded extra fabric into the shoulders of the jacket.
We waded newspapers into the cracks to keep out the winter wind.
Students secretly wad up test papers when the teacher isn't looking.
The street vendor pulled out a wad of small change from his pocket.

examples.sentence: The teddy bear's belly is stuffed with snow-white wadding.
She pulled out some wadding from the quilt to fix her pillow.
The dentist used sterile wadding to stop the bleeding.
First aid kits should include gauze wadding for wound packing.
Traditional Chinese winter jackets are lined with cotton wadding.
The ducklings waddled after their mother in the park's pond.
After eating 20 dumplings, he waddled out of the restaurant like a penguin.
The baby's first waddle across the room made everyone cheer.
The pandas waddled along the bamboo forest with their round bellies.

examples.sentence: The pandas waded through bamboo forests to find fresh shoots.
Tourists waded across the rice fields to reach the village.
Children were wading the creek to catch tadpoles.
He waded the moat to rescue the drowning duckling.
The three-day wade through the wetlands exhausted everyone.
Our wade to the waterfall was rewarded with stunning views.
The oxen were grazing near the wade in the Yellow River.
Fishermen set up nets at the tidal wade at dawn.
I had to wade through 100+ emails after vacation.
The CEO waded into the hotpot debate: spicy or mild?

examples.sentence: The old wader caught river snails barefoot like a heron.
During flood season, waders become temporary ferrymen.
The egret, a graceful wader, stands still like a white jade carving.
Flamingos are pink waders that filter shrimp with their bills.
Fishermen's waders filled with icy water during winter fishing.
His yellow waders made him look like a giant rubber duck.

examples.sentence: Bedouins use wadis as natural highways in the desert.
The abandoned car was found in a dried-up wadi.
Flash floods can suddenly fill a wadi within minutes.
Ancient trade routes often followed wadi systems.
The canyon narrowed into a steep wadi with sheer cliffs.
Nomads store rainwater in cisterns carved into wadi walls.
The rare wadi flow attracted desert animals to drink.
Children were playing in the shallow wadi after the rain.
The wadi system in Jordan stretches for hundreds of kilometers.
Wadi Rum's red sands inspired the Martian landscape in films.
The children wore wading boots to catch tadpoles in the creek.
A flamingo's wading posture looks like a ballet dancer in pink.
The wading pool at the community center is full of rubber duckies every summer.
The ice cream sandwich uses chocolate wafers as outer layers.
She crumbled the communion wafer accidentally during the ceremony.
Silicon wafers shine like metallic moons in the cleanroom.
This MEMS device requires 8-inch wafers for production.
Vintage photographs were mounted on brittle wafers.
The archivist wafered the precious manuscript pages together.
The new smartphone boasts a wafer-thin design of 5mm.
The politician waffled for 20 minutes without answering the question.
Stop waffling and tell me which hotpot restaurant to choose!
We waffled over milk tea about our favorite douyin influencers.
Grandma loves waffling with neighbors about vegetable prices.
The Belgian waffle with strawberry jam is to die for!
I burnt my first homemade waffle but pretended it was charcoal flavor.
His excuse was just a load of waffle about traffic and aliens.
The meeting was pure corporate waffle with no real decisions.
The barbecue smell wafted across the entire neighborhood.
Morning breeze wafted petals onto my WeChat manuscript.
She wafted her silk scarf dramatically like a Peking opera performer.
The fan wafted the steam from hotpot toward hungry customers.
A single cloud wafted over the Forbidden City.
The melody wafts from the ancient teahouse's erhu.
A waft of osmanthus announced the Mid-Autumn Festival.
The waft of roasted sweet potatoes triggered childhood memories.
The lantern festival wishes wafted away with paper lanterns.
The panda wagged its bamboo stalk like a conductor's baton.
Grandma wagged her fan to shoo away the flies during mahjong.
He kept wagging his tongue about the celebrity gossip.
Don't wag your tongue when eating spicy hotpot.
The dog's tail wags automatically when it sees BBQ skewers.
Willow branches wag gently in the breeze near West Lake.
Aunties wag nonstop about property prices in tea houses.
The metronome's wag kept perfect rhythm for my guzheng practice.
This stand-up comedian is the biggest wag in Beijing's hutongs.
Stray dogs wag their tails wildly outside fried chicken shops.
Tongues are wagging about the new couple in the neighborhood.
Delivery riders often earn hourly wages rather than fixed salaries.
The factory raised wages by 5% after the strike.
The villain finally received his wages of sin.
In Buddhist belief, bad karma will bring spiritual wages.
Alibaba waged a price war against Pinduoduo.
The museum is waging an anti-counterfeiting campaign.
The negotiation is still waging between the two companies.
Ancient kingdoms often waged war over salt mines.
Many cities now mandate a living wage for migrant workers.

examples.sentence: He put his vintage Rolex as a wager in the poker game.
The wager was three months' worth of bubble tea supply.
Mahjong wager is strictly prohibited during Chinese New Year family gatherings.
Online wager has destroyed many esports careers.
The dragon-head jade pendant was his final wager.
In ancient China, people sometimes used their children as wagers.
I'll wager 50 spicy crayfish that our team wins.
He wagered his entire year's salary on the stock market.
I wager this hotpot restaurant has the best beef slices in Chengdu.
She wagered her reputation that the product was authentic.
Let's wager on whether the delivery guy can climb up to 20th floor.
They're wagering over whose WeChat steps count will be higher.
Many netizens wagered on the panda cub's name.
He laid a wager that the singer would lip-sync during the live show.

examples.sentence: The panda waggled its bamboo stalk like a conductor's baton.
Her ponytail waggled excitedly during the live-streaming sale.
The bee's waggle dance revealed the location of bubble tea shops.
With a playful waggle of his eyebrows, he unlocked his phone.
Scientists translated the waggle dance as 'Turn left at the third chrysanthemum'.
The Wagnerian opera lasted five hours with giant mechanical dragons.
His Wagnerian beard made him look like a Viking singer.
True Wagnerians can recite all 15-hour Ring Cycle lyrics.
The debate reached Wagnerian intensity when they argued about opera funding.
The wedding couple arrived in a Victorian-style wagon pulled by white horses.
Pioneers traveled west in covered wagons during the Gold Rush.
The food delivery wagon got stuck in Beijing's rush hour traffic.
We loaded the last doubanjiang jars onto the freight wagon.
After his health check, Uncle Wang decided to stay on the wagon.
The Silk Road wagon trains carried tea and porcelain to the West.

examples.sentence: The kind shop owner gave hot buns to the waif shivering in the snow.
Dickens' Oliver Twist is the most famous literary waif.
The antique vase turned out to be a waif from the Ming Dynasty.
Urban explorers often find interesting waifs in abandoned factories.
Sailors use colored waifs to communicate between ships.
The submarine raised a yellow waif to request docking.
The animal shelter specializes in caring for waifs and strays.
The wail of the widow echoed through the ancient temple.
His performance turned pop songs into tragic wails.
The ambulance's wail cut through the midnight silence.
Fox wails in the forest sound like crying babies.
The opera singer's dramatic wail moved the audience to tears.
His wail after losing the game could be heard three blocks away.
The wail of the winter wind made the old house creak.
Police cars sped past with sirens at full wail.
The mother wailed over her child's broken Lego castle.
He wailed like a teakettle when he stubbed his toe.
The typhoon wailed through the power lines last night.
Electric guitars wailed at the rock concert.
Poets often wail about unrequited love in moonlit pavilions.
She wailed over her expired milk tea coupon.
Cats wail on rooftops during mating season.
The toddler wailed when his ice cream fell on the sidewalk.
KTV singers wail off-key versions of classic songs.
He wailed like a banshee when he saw his phone bill.
The baby wailed away all through the transatlantic flight.
She wailed out when she realized her dumplings were sold out.
The baby kept wailing like a fire alarm during the movie.
Midnight wailing from the haunted house turned out to be a cat in heat.
Fans were wailing when Jay Chou postponed his concert.
The wind wailing through the window crack sounds like a ghost opera.
Tourists at the Wailing Wall look like emoji ğŸ¤§ğŸ¤§ğŸ¤§

examples.sentence: The Tudor-style pub features oak wainscot reaching halfway up the walls.
Grandma's cookie jar was hidden behind the cracked wainscot.
We wainscoted the nursery with pastel-colored panels.
The landlord wainscots all units with cheap PVC materials.
The VIP lounge features mahogany wainscot paneling.

examples.sentence: Her cheongsam perfectly accentuated her slender waist.
The panda rolled on the grass, scratching its round waist.
This hanfu features an embroidered waistband at the waist.
The bullet barely missed his belt loop at the waist.
Villagers were waist-deep in floodwater rescuing piglets.
The vintage dress gives anyone an instant wasp waist illusion.
The traditional Hanfu waistband is often embroidered with cloud patterns.
His waistband snapped when he tried to do the splits at the company party.
The qipao's waistband accentuates the feminine silhouette perfectly.
After the hotpot feast, everyone secretly loosened their waistbands.
Pajamas with elastic waistbands are the ultimate lockdown fashion.
The stretchy waistband allowed him to eat three extra dumplings.

examples.sentence: The banker adjusted his silk waistcoat before the negotiation.
His tweed waistcoat perfectly matched the autumn leaves.
Street vendors often wear waistcoats with multiple pockets.
The bullet barely missed his waistcoat pocket where he kept lucky coins.
British gentlemen prefer three-piece suits with waistcoats for formal occasions.
After three months of hotpot indulgence, his waistline expanded by 5cm.
The tailor carefully measured my waistline for the qipao.
During Spring Festival, it's hard to watch your waistline with all those dumplings.
The two-hour wait for hotpot tested our patience.
The app shows real-time wait times for Disney rides.
I'll wait your reply while eating spicy crayfish.
Grandma waits her turn to scan the health QR code.
We're waiting the new iPhone release like waiting for New Year's red envelopes.
He waited dinner until his wife finished her live-streaming.
Delivery guys often wait outside gated communities.
We're waiting for the high-speed rail to arrive.
Don't wait till the last day to renew your residence permit.
In traditional tea houses, staff wait on customers with long-spout kettles.
Parents often wait up for children playing outside.

In hotpot restaurants, waiters wear roller skates for faster service.
The head waiter juggles reservations like a circus performer.

examples.sentence: The waiting for hot pot seats always smells better than the actual eating.
Her life became a waiting game for express deliveries.
The waiting passengers formed a dragon-like queue at the train station.
All waiting taxis had their 'occupied' lights on during rush hour.
The waiting staff at this hotpot restaurant can peel shrimp with their eyes closed.
Royal waiting maids needed 3 years of cucumber-slicing training.
The doctor in waiting played Mario Kart to stay alert.
The VIP waiting list for this milk tea is longer than the Great Wall.
The waitress in hanfu served tea with ancient capital etiquette.
A viral video showed a waitress stopping a child from wasting food.
The hotpot waitress remembered all 15 tables' spice preferences.
She worked as a KFC waitress during college summers.
The chief waitress at this Michelin restaurant speaks 4 dialects.

examples.sentence: The hotel waived the late checkout fee for our crying toddler.
Taobao sellers often waive shipping fees to attract customers.
He waived his right to legal counsel to save face.
Olympic athletes never waive their dreams easily.
Let's waive this sensitive topic until the next meeting.
The professor waived discussing the final exam format today.
Delivery guys often waive damaged packages at the warehouse.
Don't waive your mask improperly during pandemic.
She waived aside the complaint like yesterday's news.
The diplomat waived immunity to testify in the case.
The billionaire's waiver of inheritance shocked his family.
Waiver of intellectual property rights is rare in tech companies.
All skydivers must sign a waiver before jumping.
The gym's waiver form has 8 pages of fine print.
You'll need to sign a waiver before eating this ultra-spicy hotpot.
My mom wakes me with Peking opera at 6am.
The delivery guy waking neighbors is China's most hated alarm clock.
The documentary woke her interest in Dunhuang murals.
Spicy hotpot always wakes my numb tongue.
I wake to the smell of fried dough sticks every morning.
Bears wake from hibernation when spring comes.
She lay waking, counting sheep jumping over the Great Wall.
The nation woke to the importance of AI development.
The ancient town wakes when lanterns are lit at night.
Spring Festival Eve wake is a tradition in my hometown.
The high-speed train left a silver wake in the sunset.
Archaeologists found wakes of ancient tea trade routes.
I wake up to Douyin alarm sounds daily.
In the wake of livestreaming, many farmers became internet celebrities.
The wakeful student noticed the teacher's new hairstyle immediately.
In the wakeful hours before dawn, he planned his TikTok strategy.
The wakeful guard caught the midnight snack thief red-handed.
Stay wakeful when browsing at 3am - you might accidentally like your ex's post.
The wakeful baby turned mom's dark circles into panda-level artwork.
Too much bubble tea left me wakeful counting sheep made of tapioca pearls.
Double espresso guaranteed me a wakeful night full of spreadsheet visions.

examples.sentence: The rooster wakens villagers at dawn like a living alarm clock.

examples.sentence: The wizard waved his wand and turned a pumpkin into a carriage.

examples.sentence: The influencer wangled out of the scandal by posting cute cat videos.

The new phone's battery life proved wanting after heavy gaming.
The substitute teacher was deemed wanting for the advanced class.
Fast food is nutritionally wanting compared to home cooking.
Wanting proper tools, he fixed the bike with a kitchen knife.
The dessert was served wanting its signature cherry topping.
Wanting two players, the team had to forfeit the match.
The report was submitted wanting crucial data charts.

examples.sentence: Victorian novels often portray fallen women as wantons.
The peacock feather became her wanton emblem in the play.
The wanton destruction of cultural relics sparked outrage.
Wanton cyberbullying violates platform regulations.
His wanton consumption of boba tea shocked nutritionists.
The wanton use of filters distorted her facial features.
Wanton ivy covered the abandoned post office.
The garden's wanton growth attracted butterflies.
He wantoned away his summer playing mobile games.
The heir wantoned with his family fortune on livestreaming gifts.
The pandas rolled wantonly in the bamboo grove, crushing seedlings with their chubby bodies.
Children dashed wantonly through sprinklers, their laughter mixing with the hiss of water.
The nouveau riche spent money wantonly on gold-plated toilet brushes.
Historical records show the emperor wantonly executed ministers for trivial reasons.
Tropical plants grew wantonly after the typhoon, their vines strangling broken lampposts.
The abandoned lot blossomed wantonly with wild peonies, their roots cracking concrete.
Kudzu vines grow wantonly across the American South, swallowing entire houses.
